original_title: Sri Lanka targets 2.3 million tourists in 2024
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka is targeting 2.3 million tourists in 2024 with India, Russia, China, the United Kingdom and Germany expected to bring most of the arrivals, Chairman of the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA), Priyantha Fernando said.
India expected to bring in a majority of visitors with a target of 310,000 – 343,000 tourists.
Sri Lanka is targeting at least 258,000 tourists from Russia, 251,000 from China, 193,000 from the UK and 151,000 from Germany.
Sri Lanka tourist authorities are promoting the country with internationally including through the use of social media influencers.
In addition, several domestic events are also planned in tourist hotspots.
“We would be having several festivals in areas such as Weligama and Unawatuna,” Fernando, told EconomyNext.
“There is a Baila festival happening closer to the Galle Literary Festival.”
In 2023, arrivals may fall slightly short of a 1.55 million target, he said.
In December delays in approval of charter flights had cost some tourists from Russia.
Up to November 2023 Sri Lanka had welcomed 1,243,052 tourists compared to only 719,978 tourists in the whole of 2022 when the country was hit by a currency crisis.
India was the top generating market with 251,497 arrivals up to November 2023. (Colombo/Nov28/2023)
